content: SEC. 101. Extension of the Temporary Assistance for Needy Families Block Grant Program through March 31, 2004. Activities authorized by part A of title IV of the Social Security Act, and by sections 510, 1108(b), and 1925, shall continue through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations. Grants and payments may be made for activities in the first two quarters of fiscal year 2004 at the level provided for in 2002. Amendments are made for supplemental grants in certain states. Amendments are made to various sections of the Social Security Act, including changes to fiscal years and contingency funds. Maintenance of effort requirements are also updated for 2004 and 2005. The National Random Sample Study of Child Welfare and Child Welfare Waiver Authority is extended through March 31, 2004, with necessary appropriations. Grants and payments will continue at the same level as in fiscal year 2002. Additionally, there is a disclosure of return information amendment for income contingent repayment of student loans, extending the deadline to December 31, 2004. SEC. 202. Extension of Internal Revenue Service user fees under Chapter 77 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986. A new section, SEC. 7528, is added for Internal Revenue Service user fees. The Secretary will establish a program for user fees on requests to the IRS for ruling letters and other similar requests. Fees will vary based on categories, be determined by request complexity, and must be paid in advance. Exemptions and reduced fees will be provided as deemed appropriate, with an exemption for certain pension plan determination requests. The Secretary will not require user fees for requests regarding pension plans maintained by eligible employers or trusts as part of the plan. The pension benefit plan must meet certain requirements by the end of the fifth plan year or the remedial amendment period within the first 5 plan years. The Revenue Act of 1987 and the Economic Growth and Tax Relief Reconciliation Act of 2001 are repealed. The amendment in the Miscellaneous Appropriations Act, 2003 changes the date from September 30, 2003, to March 31, 2004. The effective date of the amendment can be delayed by the Secretary of Health and Human Services until November 1, 2003, if implementation is not feasible. The Secretary may delay implementation of rate changes until November 1, 2003. If delayed, adjustments will be made for fiscal year 2004 to ensure total payments remain the same.
